thread.title: Ground News - Israeli military ‘regrets civilian harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camps
thread.title_full: Ground News - Israeli military ‘regrets civilian harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camps

author: Evening Standard
title: Ground News - Israeli military ‘regrets civilian harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camps
text:
Summary by Evening Standard Israel has said it “regrets the harm” caused by airstrikes that killed dozens of civilians earlier this week. Share menu More
Filters 9 Articles 9 Articles All Left Center Right
Evening Standard Center Mixed Factuality Individual: Evgeny Lebedev Independent: Alfred Harmsworth (Barrister) Israeli military ‘regrets civilian harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camps Israel has said it “regrets the harm” caused by airstrikes that killed dozens of civilians earlier this week.
2 hours ago · London, United Kingdom Read Full Article
Evening Standard Center Mixed Factuality Individual: Evgeny Lebedev Independent: Alfred Harmsworth (Barrister)
Israeli military ‘regrets civilian harm’ after more than 100 killed in refugee camps Israel has said it “regrets the harm” caused by airstrikes that killed dozens of civilians earlier this week.
2 hours ago · London, United Kingdom Read Full Article Sky News Australia Lean Right Mixed Factuality Media Conglomerate: Murdoch Family Israeli military says it ‘regrets harm’ to civilians after refugee camp strike The Israeli military says it “regrets the harm” caused to civilians by an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) strike in the Maghazi refugee camp in the centre of Gaza. The United Nations estimates that 86 people died in the strike. The Israeli Defence Force have released a statement following investigations into the air strike on Christmas Eve. "A preliminary investigation revealed that additional buildings located near the targets were also hit durin…

Israeli military says it ‘regrets harm’ to civilians after refugee camp strike The Israeli military says it “regrets the harm” caused to civilians by an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) strike in the Maghazi refugee camp in the centre of Gaza. The United Nations estimates that 86 people died in the strike. The Israeli Defence Force have released a statement following investigations into the air strike on Christmas Eve. "A preliminary investigation revealed that additional buildings located near the targets were also hit durin…
2 hours ago · Australia Read Full Article nordbayern.de Israel regrets civilian deaths in attack on Gaza Gaza/Tel Aviv - More than 70 people are said to have died in air strikes on December 24 in the Gaza Strip. Israel expresses regret and wants to investigate the incident. But the war continues. An overview.
5 hours ago · Germany Read Full Article
nordbayern.de
Israel regrets civilian deaths in attack on Gaza Gaza/Tel Aviv - More than 70 people are said to have died in air strikes on December 24 in the Gaza Strip. Israel expresses regret and wants to investigate the incident. But the war continues. An overview.
5 hours ago · Germany Read Full Article rnd.de Israel's army expresses regret after air strike in refugee quarters On Christmas Eve, Israel attacks targets in a refugee district in the Gaza Strip from the air. Dozens of people, including many civilians, women and children, are killed. An investigation into the incident is intended to explain how this could have happened.
8 hours ago · Germany Read Full Article

Israel's army expresses regret after air strike in refugee quarters On Christmas Eve, Israel attacks targets in a refugee district in the Gaza Strip from the air. Dozens of people, including many civilians, women and children, are killed. An investigation into the incident is intended to explain how this could have happened.
8 hours ago · Germany Read Full Article berlingske.dk Lean Right Mixed Factuality Independent: Berlingske Media Israeli army regrets accidental casualties in attack on refugee camp The attack on the refugee camp was not intended to cause such heavy civilian casualties, Israel's army said in a statement.

Israeli army regrets accidental casualties in attack on refugee camp The attack on the refugee camp was not intended to cause such heavy civilian casualties, Israel's army said in a statement.
